headline: Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Pumpkin chocolate chip cookies for those of us who love pumpkin pie and chocolate. These cake-like cookies are delicious and perfect for fall.

video.description: Here’s a cookie for the pumpkin pie and chocolate lovers!
video.name: Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Cookies

name: Pumpkin Chocolate Chip Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a baking sheet.
Combine pumpkin, sugar, oil, and egg in a large bowl. Dissolve baking soda into milk in a small bowl and stir in.
Stir together flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a separate bowl. Add flour mixture to pumpkin mixture and mix well. Add chocolate chips, walnuts, and vanilla; stir just to combine.
Drop by spoonful on the prepared cookie sheet and bake in the preheated oven until lightly brown and firm, approximately 10 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Made no changes. Delicious, moist, perfect in every way. Great recipe!
Well it was good. I did it in bars

These are pretty good, but with adjustments, they are the best! For more pumpkin-y tastiness: -Add a whole can of pumpkin or more (not just a cup) -Use less oil (maybe half) -Use less sugar (maybe 3/4 C or less) -Grease the pan with butter before each batch *I didn't add milk or vanilla because I don't ever have milk on hand and vanilla is expensive and I am poor For vegan cookies: -Omit egg -Omit Chocolate Chips -Omit milk -Still use less oil -Still add more pumpkin -Still use less sugar The consistency is great and no other adjustments are needed. Super easy to make a dual batch. Whip up the vegan portion of the batter, scoop out five or so cookies, then add egg and chocolate chips to the remaining batter. My buddies love these, (granted my buddies are starving college students who will eat just about anything) and always ask for them. My vegan buddy also really loves these bad boys (the vegan version, of course). She is always tempted to munch on the regulars once hers are up. 'Tis the season for pumpkin!

These were very yummy, the consistency is cakey so if that's not something you are into you may not like this cookie. Having said that I read a lot of the reviews while I was baking and tested out 2 different sized cookies and 2 different temps and 2 cooking times. My husband and I taste tested them together and both agreed the first batch was the best! First batch, medium spoon scoop, at 350 for 12 minutes. Soft, moist, good flavor. Second batch, smaller medium scoop, 365 for 10 minutes, soft and I could really taste the baking soda. My least favorite... Third batch, same smaller medium scoop as batch 2, 365 degrees, more solid, I probably would have loved it, If I hadn't tried the first batch... Hope this is helpful and happy baking!!

These cookies are reminiscent of my mother's baking for our school lunches in the Fall. I made some changes based on other reviewer's comments and my own tastes. I didn't want the chocolate to be the predominate flavor, so I added just 1 c. chocolate chips. To make them similar to my mother's cookies, I added 1/2 cup raisins with the nuts. Reduced the cinnamon to 1 t. and added a shake of other spices to increase the pumpkin/Fall flavors: nutmeg, ginger, allspice & clove. By reducing the chocolate chips it reduced the sweetness of the cookie, so the next time I make these I will add a bit more sugar. Brown sugar would probably increase depth of flavor of these cookies. I plan to experiment the next time I make these by changing it to 1/2 white sugar & 1/2 brown sugar, or to possibly add a couple of tablespoons of brown sugar to bump up the sweetness. With my changes this recipe yielded 38 medium sized cookies for me. I will make this one again and again, it's a great Fall cookie!

These have quickly become the favorite of my son's football team, and I love how easy they are. I made a quadruple batch (13 dozen cookies when made with a cookie scoop) and it took me about 3 hours. It would have been less time if I had slightly smaller cookie sheets and could fit 2 at a time in my oven. The only change I make is adding more chocolate chips and leaving out the nuts.
Bake time was 12 minutes. Could not really taste the pumpkin but did make a nice soft chocolate chip cookie.

Best pumpkin chocolate chip cookies recipe ever!!!! My sisters and I make these cookies for our families multiple times thoughout the fall and winter months and we always watch the video while we make these cookies! The lady’s voice sounds so pretty and we always quote her “when the leaves start changing and the weather turns crisp I start getting requests for these cookies” Love it!
No changes.....just omitted nuts. Love them! small scoop = 36 cookies 12 min
I love it it takes a little longer to bake though

I love these cookies. I went the opposite direction of a previous poster who adjusted to make them healthier - I was out of vegetable oil and only had lard in the cupboard! You better believe they are good!
Love this recipe have made it several times, the cookies are so soft and I can't resist eating them all. I prefer them without the nuts but add extra chocolate chips.

I've been using this recipe (with some minor changes) for 10+ years and it's one of the biggest hits both in my home and wherever I take them to share! For a "healthier" and yummier version, I do the following: 

1) Instead of using vegetable oil, I use a barely melted stick of organic butter. 
2) Since vanilla extract costs more than liquid gold, I can assure you that these will be *just* as delicious with one teaspoon instead of one tablespoon of vanilla extract. 
3) I add a dash or two of ground cloves. 
4) 3/4 cup of chocolate chips is plenty, too - quite a bit actually, these are chocolaty cookies! 
5) Because most recipes call for a cup of pumpkin and a can of pumpkin contains 1 and 3/4 cup... I just use half a can, so slightly less than a cup. Save the other half for another whole batch of these or another recipe. 
6) I use an organic egg from true free-range chicken - the ones with the deep orangy yolk. 
7) I use organic unbleached white flour. 
8) I use pink Himalayan salt instead of regular table salt.

I DO mix the milk and the baking soda and add it to the flour mixture. I bake them on a pizza stone, 12 cookies at a time, at 350f. They need about 12 minutes. We like them just a bit gooey.

They are best about 10-15 mins after they come out of the oven, or from the fridge the next day. If you let them sit out on the counter or in a bowl at room temperature, they are not the greatest. Slightly cooled but still warm from the oven - where the chocolate is still gooey
These cookies weren't bad, but not very good either. They were flat, batter was too runny. I couldn't taste pumpkin at all, only vanilla and cinnamon.

I don’t think these are half bad. There is a lot of baking powder/soda and the cookies appear a little drier than I thought, definitely something that needs to be eaten quickly. You can taste the baking powder/soda once it is cooked, which I am not a huge fan of. Also the use of just cinnamon means the flavor isn’t very complex.
My family loves these cookies. Best recipe using pumpkin for cookies by far.
These are mine and my family’s favorite cookies we make them every year and they are always a hit
I like my cookies to be crispier. These were very thick, and not crispy at all. They're okay, just not my preference.
good but makes 42 cookies if you do the same amount of ingredients next time handing it
Awesome! Not too sweet!
I make these every fall season, and they are by far my favorite treat to make.
Reduced the sugar to 3/4 cup and used half a banana instead of the egg. So soft and absolutely delicious, it was really difficult to stop eating them!

I substituted butterscotch chips for the chocolate chips because that's what I had and I didn't include the optional walnuts. The cookies are SO YUMMY. Makes Thanksgiving feel so good, even though we have a little over a week until...
Best pumpkin cookies I’ve ever made. I made zero changes to the recipe and they came out perfectly. If you want a moist, cake like cookie, this is the one. I dare you to only eat one!
I LOVE THEM these are so good I made them for my family and they said they were amazing the only thing I changed is pre heat the oven to 365°f cook for 12 minutes and add 2/8 tsp nut meg.
Love these! Total doofus move and accidentally added 1 whole can of pumpkin. But it still worked and did not disappoint! Took a bit longer to cook since they were more wet.
My four year old grandson says" these are really squishy". My 9 year old grandaughter helped make them and liked them. In my oven they needed to bake a little longer than 10 minutes though.

I did 1/2 cup brown sugar + 1/2 cup white sugar, used almond milk, and replaced the egg + oil with 4oz unsweetened applesauce. They came out more like muffin tops than traditional cookies, but I liked them.

My only complaint was that the chocolate chips overpowered the pumpkin. I'd probably reduce it to 1 cup in the future.
I did not like the consistency of these! The only edible part was the chocolate chips.

I am adding a second review because i cant edit my original. First time around i gave it 4 stars, that was hot out of the oven last night. Today we ate them cold from the frig and OMG now i give 5 stars! 
Next time i will sub applesauce for the oil just to make it healthier. And i may add a drop of red food color just to make it more orange for Halloween.
This recipient was really good! I subsitute some of the chocolate chips for white chocolate chips...
Super moist good cookie
I only used 1/2 the sugar and 1/2 the chocolate chips listed in the recipe and it still turned out very sweet.

I’ve done several recipes for these, and this one isn’t bad at all! They are very cake-like. So, the baking time is pretty much solid & you do NOT want to leave them in any longer, or they will end up very dry in consistency. I opt to do half semi-sweet chocolate chips, and half milk chocolate. I also add a pinch of nutmeg in, for the seasonal aspect. These are soft, fluffy & moist, which is perfect solo, or paired with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. I make them every year during the fall season, and this recipe is a solid one!

These cookies were SO GOOD! So soft and moist. I thought 2 cups of chocolate chips was a lot, but it's really the perfect amount. Will make them again for my boyfriend to take to work at the firehouse.
This review is based on this recipe as written.
Absolutely delicious!! As my little grandson ate his first one, he closed his eyes and just said , “mmmmm” soooo good
While I enjoy the idea of pumpkin cookies, these do nothing for me. I have tried making them twice and both times they have been dense and cakey. I don't enjoy them.

Literally the best pumpkin chocolate chip cookie recipe I have ever used. Absolutely amazing. I've been making this exact recipe for 8 years, and my family loves them. I make then several times during the fall and winter months. So delicious. Could give 10 stars if I could.

I have been making these cookies for the past 5-6 years, and every time they come out perfectly! Not to mention the number of people who are completely blown away by the fall goodness! I like to use fresh pumpkin (just make sure you strain it! SO good would recommend a million times over!

I have been making these cookies for YEARS and they are just fabulous! Instead of using canned pumpkin I typically bake my own whole pumpkin and use the meat out of that as opposed to canned. Either way you cannot go wrong. 
Start baking these cookies and before you know it everyone will be requesting them throughout the entire fall season. Trust me I bake about 3 or 4 of these batches a year during the fall.
My favorite pumpkin chocolate chip cookie recipe. I added a bit more pumpkin in it! Family favorite!!
tasted great!

There were way too many chocolate chips in this recipe for me. I would probably only use 1 cup of chocolate chips. Also I baked them a little longer than 10 minutes because they were looking very light. I will probably never make this recipe again.
I made these cookies for my brothers birthday party and everyone loved them I had to make more!!

Delicious recipes had to adjust time by 5 min but that could also be because of the cookie sheet I used as well as I tend to make cookies on the larger size. No matter though they turned out absolutely wonderful. Thank you for the recipe.
Omitted the oil entirely and they still turned out moist, fluffy, and delicious!

This recipe is awesome. The cookies are very moist and have a consistency like cake! I am definitely going to make this again. But i changed the amount of baking soda i used 3 tbs because they rise nicely.
I love these cookies! The way the cinnamon, pumpkin, and chocolate chips clash is just spectacular my family loves these cookies i am definitely going to make them again!
They were the softest, moistest cookies I have ever had or made and they were Delicious.
I didn't have chocolate chips or walnuts so I added a half a cup of marshmallows instead.
Loved these as is without any changes!
made this recipe over and over and everyone loves hope big and cakey they are... even the pumpkin haters cheer for this recipe
I love this receipe! It is amazingly yummy!

I used coconut oil instead of vegetable oil like another reviewer suggested. It worked great. I didn’t want to use canola oil because I’ve never heard of a canola, so where does the oil come from. The cookies were really great. Others said they were cake like, and they were but not overly cake-y. They were still like a cookie texture. I added 1/8 tsp ginger, 1/4 tsp nutmeg and an extra 1/4 tsp cinnamon. Also I added an extra 1/2 tsp vanilla extract. I even substituted half the sugar for organic stevia leaf powder. I didn’t miss the sugar at all. Fantastic recipe.
I add a little bit of extra pumpkin and it makes the cookies more doughy. If you don't like your cookies like that then the normal recipe is great.
I used pureed pumpkin that I made and then froze for later use. it was delicious. I added a cup of extra walnuts, and I only used 1 cup of chocolate
I had to bake them for 12 minutes instead of 10, but otherwise, they turned out very nice and fluffy!
I used pumpkin from my garden (go me!) This recipe is one I’ve used for at least three seasons now and it’s solid. LOVE these cookies!
Turned out awesome! Husband says it's his new favorite dessert I've made
I used organic flour. Everyone loved the cookies. Will definitely make again!
yes and yes i will make it again

Made this using the exact recipe. I’ve never been a fan of the pumpkin flavor in general, but these are delightful! Very easy to make and a perfect dessert for the holidays. Mine took about 15-17 minutes to bake but I had almost all 24 in the oven.
add more spices

Too many chocolate chips and NOT ENOUGH FLAVOR and I even added additional cinnamon and nutmeg.
The texture was good - but everything else was lacking.

These cookies are awesome. I found that I needed to up the baking time from 10 minutes to more like 12-15 minutes, as the recipe says the cookies must be firm when baked. At 10 minutes, they are still very much unbaked. So Good and Gooey, even firm. Yummy!
*11/17/19: I've made this numerous time as written, and it's great. Today I added 1.5x the cinnamon, some nutmeg, and a bit of cloves. I like this even better.
Sooo good and fluffy

Favorite pumpkin cookie recipe. I’ve been making them for years and everyone always asks me for the recipe or to bake them. I do half chocolate chips half white and I add pumpkin pie spices. The white chocolate chips is the game changer though.
The taste was good, however, the consistency was way too gooey! I even tried to bake them longer than the suggested time. I will not be using this recipe again.

I made two batches of these cookies. The first batch I made exactly as written, and they were good but not great- 4/5 stars. They fell flat and weren't cakey like typical pumpkin chocolate chip cookies are, and were slightly unappealing looking but tasted fine. The second batch I added a dash of nutmeg and cloves, and baked them at 365 for 14 minutes (bake time/temp could be my oven's issue) and they came out perfect. I did also add a couple drops of orange food coloring to keep the color vibrant

I made it, but like other comments, cut the cinnamon in half, and added 1tsp nutmeg and 1/2tsp each cloves and ginger. I also cooked at around 365 for 12 minutes. My daughter just asked me to make them for her hs anatomy class “thanksgiving.”
Will definitely make again and again! Both home family and work family loved them! Just added pumpkin pie spice and nutmeg! Thanks for sharing!

I have made this recipe several times—once with pumpkin, the other times with mashed bananas! So tasty both ways. Make sure to not overbake...if you make these with banana they will not look done after 9 mins, but they keep baking on the pan after removal from the oven. Yum yum!!!

1. Used whole can of pumpkin instead of just the cup, plus 2 extra tablespoons of white sugar to sweeten the extra pumpkin. 2. Added vanilla to the wet ingredients, since I don't think that is specifically stated in recipe directions. 3. Added baking soda directly to dry ingredients and omitted milk. (I always use a small, closely tined whisk to blend dry ingredients before combining with wet items.) Everything else was exactly as directed. These are scrumptious!
It is easy to make.
One of my favorite cookies to make! The only thing I add like others is a bit of nutmeg.
I left out cinnamon because I’m not a fan of it & I baked for 12 mins. They are very good cold or hot!! Easy to make I kind of had to squish them a bit to get more of a cookie shape
The bomb! I asked my kids it it tastes like the one from the bakery and they said it tastes better! Making it again right now
Delicious. Didn’t change a thing
I have made some with no nuts, and some no nuts and cinnamon chips instead of chocolate chips
I just didn't put nuts in it.
I followed directions as written and they are awesome! My oven took 14 minutes at 350. They're really great.
Love these cookies as do my family!!!

These are excellent! I followed the recipe exactly, but changed the cooking time to 12 minutes at 365 degrees, following the advice in previous reviews. The texture definitely is cakey, but very good. Next time I will try applesauce instead of oil to make them a little healthier.
They are amazing but when I made them I did half white chocolate chips and half semi sweet chocolate chips and they .. were... AMAZING
Didn’t make any changes but thinking of minimizing the amount of sugar next time to see if that makes them better for diabetics
Followed recipe exactly , just added nutmeg
Made recipe as is. Turned out great.
My fiance hasn't had pumpkin chocolate chip cookies before, he loves them! I've been craving them for a while and it was really nice making them with him on this Family Day.
I just made these cookies, but want to tell you they are very moist and have to chill overnight in order to roll into a ball for cookies and my grandchildren loved them!

My son loves pumpkin and chocolate chip cookies. This recipe combined his two loves and they came out great. I loved the moist, almost cake-like texture. Living at an elevation of over 3000 feet I made a few tweaks to get the consistency I desired; 1 tbsp more flour, 1 tbsp less sugar, and about 1/4th tsp less of the baking soda. My son also requested the addition a few pinches of both nutmeg and clove. I’ll definitely make this recipe again.

I've made these cookies since the mid 1970's. Love 'em. But one thing that never made sense to me is that it calls for 1 cup of canned pumpkin. But you have pumpkin leftover. I solved that issue by using the full can of pumpkin and doubling the other ingredients (except the chocolate chips). A can of pumpkin is less than 2 cups, but the cookies turn out just fine and I do not have leftover pumpkin. Works for me! I also like using mini-chocolate chips.
These cookies are delicious! Easy to make and the results are a cake like cookie that you keep going back for more.
Most definitely love these! Baking them again today!
I used just one cup of mini chocolate chips, and there was plenty of chocolate flavor in each cookie. This is a favorite with my friends and family.

I have been making these for about 5 years. When I moved to Maine I looked and looked for the cookies all the bakeries in Utah made. No bakeries here make ;them. Finally I found this one... love it. So does the whole family. I also used the whole small can of pumpkin puree and just added what the recipe called for of the other ingredients and then halved the rest of ingredients, yes including the chocolate. Yummy.
This is a great recipe. I don't use as many chocolate chips as the recipe calls for and I do what another reviewer recommended and cooked them for 12 minutes at 365. They turned out perfect!
I loved it and added extra chocolate, my coworkers keep asking for more
